s.text: Dutch central banker Wim Duisenberg, the candidate supported by all European Union members except France, will "voluntarily" serve only half of his statutory eight year term and will then be replaced by the governor of the Bank of France, Jean-Claude Trichet.

The Paris newspaper led its front page with the headline "Euro: outrage in Germany," referring to the "violent attacks" in the German press against the compromise agreed between Germany and France over the presidency of the new European Central Bank, which will manage the euro.
